content: short sleeved raglan cardigan for mini ag dolls by dawn smith you will need  light fingering yarn  2 25 mm crochet hook also called b or size 2 abbreviations chain - chain scs single_crochet stitches single_crochet - single_crochet increase raglan increase - see below slip_stitch slip_stitch decrease decrease by single crocheting two stitches together all increases in row 2 - 7 are raglan increases sc1 ch2 sc1 in the same stitch in row 2 they will be made in the next single_crochet in row 3-7 they will be made in the ch2 spaces pattern starts here chain 22 row 1 single_crochet in second chain from hook single_crochet across 21 scs row 2 ch1 turn single_crochet 3 increase sc2 increase single_crochet 7 increase single_crochet 2 increase single_crochet 3 25 scs and 4 - ch2 spaces row 3 ch1 turn sc4 increase sc4 increase sc9 increase sc4 increase sc4 29 scs and 4 - ch2 spaces row 4 ch1 turn sc5 increase sc6 increase sc11 increase sc6 increase sc5 34 scs and 4 - ch2 spaces row 5 ch1 turn sc6 increase sc8 increase sc13 increase sc8 increase sc6 39 scs and 4 - ch2 spaces row 6 ch1 turn sc7 increase sc10 increase sc15 increase sc10 increase sc7 44 scs and 4 - ch2 spaces row 7 chain 1 turn single_crochet 8 increase single_crochet 3 decrease sc2 decrease sc3 increase sc17 repeat * increase sc8 59 scs and 4 ch2 spaces row 8 ch1 turn sc9 place hook into the chain 2 space skip next 10 single_crochet which are the sleeve stitches place hook into the next ch2 space and single_crochet closing the armhole sc19 for the back repeat * single_crochet 9 39 scs row 9-11 chain 1 turn single_crochet across row 12 ruffled hem chain 2 turn double_crochet 2 in each stitch across 78 dcs or for an alternate scalloped hem single_crochet 2dc in the first st skip the next st across single_crochet around three sides of the garment up the front across the neck down the other front to the hem finish off ©dawn smith july 17 2024
